description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, Kate chose to play option 2.John chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -3000.
Mutual selection of option 2 results in catastrophic payoffs (-input × 1000), incentivizing both players to avoid this outcome.
John’s model (OpenAI o3-mini) can deviate from its default action (option 1) based on Kate’s strategy, indicating adaptive behavior.
Access to each other’s APIs introduces strategic interdependence, risking recursive exploitation attempts (e.g., both choosing 2 to preempt losses).
The payoff structure mirrors a high-stakes prisoner’s dilemma: mutual cooperation (option 1) yields neutral payoffs, while defection (option 2) risks severe penalties but offers short-term gains.
